targets.expr: label_replace(node_uname_info{instance="$node:$port"}, "node",  "$0", "nodename", ".*") * on(node) group_right sum(kube_node_labels) by (node, label_zone, label_dedicated, label_failure_domain_beta_kubernetes_io_zone, label_beta_kubernetes_io_instance_type)

panels.description: Shows average size of a single disk operation.
panels.title: Disk IO Avg Size / second

panels.description: Shows volume of reads and writes the storage is handling. This can be better measure of IO capacity usage for network attached and SSD storage as it is often bandwidth limited.  Amount of data being written to the disk can be used to estimate Flash storage life time.
panels.title: Disk Bandwidth

targets.expr:
((min by(device, instance) (node_filesystem_size_bytes{device!~"rootfs|tmpfs", instance="$node:$port"}) -
min by(device, instance) (node_filesystem_avail_bytes{device!~"rootfs|tmpfs", instance="$node:$port"})) /
min by(device, instance) (node_filesystem_size_bytes{device!~"rootfs|tmpfs", instance="$node:$port"})) * 100

(min by(device, instance) (node_filesystem_size_bytes{device!~"rootfs|tmpfs", instance="$node:$port"}) -
min by(device, instance) (node_filesystem_avail_bytes{device!~"rootfs|tmpfs", instance="$node:$port"}))

panels.description: Shows how effectively Operating System is able to merge logical IO requests into physical requests.  This is a good measure of the IO locality which can be used for workload characterization.
panels.title: Disk (wrqm & rrqm) / second
